pageContext.claim: “My whole life, I've heard you're innocent until proven guilty. But now, you're guilty until proven innocent. That is a very, very difficult standard.”
pageContext.analysis: This is rich, considering Trump bought newspaper ads to call for the death penalty when a group of black and Latino teenagers in New York was accused of murdering a jogger in Central Park in 1989. Trump never apologized, even after the teenagers were cleared. But when his Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh was facing accusations of sexual assault, Trump was all about the presumption of innocence.
